website_summaries.verdict: A remarkably low-cost option for the home enthusiast undertaking repairs or modest construction jobs.
pros: The extensive feature list reads like that of a pro tool, yet its budget price brings it within the reach of the average householder

customer_reviews.title: Nailer problem.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this nailer with 1" recommended roofing nails. Project, secure cement board to OSB wall. Nailer never misfired but about every fourth nail would go on a diagonal an not secure to OSB wall. Not happy with that, I tried nailer and nails on a small composition roofing project. Once again a nail would come out on a diagonal about third to fifth nail. I believe the wire holding the nails in a band is to strong for the shorter nails. The nails have to far to travel before exiting the nailer allowing them to twist in the barrel. Longer nails should work better! I hope!
customer_reviews.author: findit

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: I had some apprehension about getting a cheaper, non-name brand nailer, but this is a solid tool. Shingled my entire garage roof with it, and had no major issues. Only critique is that every so often, it’ll double tap with a single trigger pull. But that’s once every hundred or more, not a deal breaker by any stretch. And the price was about the same for RENTING a name brand for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Used this to side a whole house and garage. lots of nails through this gun with only a couple of double nail shots, which I new this gun was noted for, but for the price it is just what I like.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Work good for an hour
customer_reviews.text: Sucked on the 3rd reload I started having trouble with nails not feeding properly and both guns I bought were shooting double nails causing a jam. I'm a 20 year union carpenter I know how to use the tool and I had good nails. I ran to home depot grabbed 2 new guns and have been using them everyday since. Of course they were more expensive but I have maybe 1 jam all day....normal
customer_reviews.author: Alan Felix

customer_reviews.title: Pull trigger before you push tip down to prevent double shot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to roof my shed. 18x18 roof. Worked great. It wanted to double shoot when I pulled the trigger at first then I realized it worked better if you pull the trigger before you push it against the shingle. Just hold the trigger down and bounce it off the shingle. It won’t fire until it hits the shingle.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and reliable, probably best for small projects.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and just what I needed for my small shop project. Fed nails without fail, always popped the last nail out so you know you need to put in a new roll. I have no idea if this gun would last through a major project, I only used it for one day, but it was well worth the $100 to not have to spend that day nailing by hand. The only thing that made me nervous was the plastic magazine for the nails. If this fell off the roof onto that magazine it would break for sure, which might leave you with a non-functioning nail gun. Everything else seems very robust.
customer_reviews.author: md

customer_reviews.title: Does it
customer_reviews.text: I just finished 10 squares of shingles. This gun was bought for this one job and anything else would be considered gravy. Instead of $300+ this roof nailer did great for a hundred. Plan to finish the half done roof and have no reason to think it won't. The only misfires were when the coil was short, down to a few nails you might have a two shot. My wife even used it since she can climb around on the roof like a big monkey. She said, 'This doesn't work right!' when multiple nails fired--because she kept squeezing the trigger. Lay off, muscles! It's not a machine gun.
customer_reviews.author: shemayah phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good little nailer!
customer_reviews.text: My old Paslode started leaking in the middle of a job so I bought this one to finish up. Works as good as the much more expensive Paslode and I think it's lighter. No idea if it will last as long but I'm happy with it so far and it's a great backup. When I repair the Paslode, I'll probably keep using this one and the Paslode will be the backup. Seems very well made and an excellent value. I recommend to my friends and I'd buy another.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Decent working gun
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for a 25sq job. No misfires at all, but I kept it well oiled. The only issue I found was the coil cover was a tad flimsy. This could break easily if you are one to throw your guns around like an idiot. Functioned as well or better than my high dollar guns.
customer_reviews.author: Cory and Angela Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool
customer_reviews.text: Framed houses, decks etc for years.. I read reviews about issues? had none, normal nail skip,-open, make sure nails are not bound up, keep going, no dbl shots, don;t hold it down, it will dbl shoot all guns do, one push or bang to get one nail. oil tool every roll of nails i put 5-10 drops in, I used the nails that amazon suggested, no issues................. Now this if for harry home owner, if you have a construction company or roofing company, I would use paslode.
customer_reviews.author: John & Lin

customer_reviews.title: good value for money but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I blacken a lot of fingers with a hammer. Needed to roof the shed. Not going to spend big bucks on that. I have no regrets in purchasing this tool but like many other reviewers I got a lot of double nail firings. I still would do it again. I wonder since so many of us reviewers bought it for home use and are not professionals, if there is an adjustment either on the tool or air pressure that would reduce the misfirings. Anyone know?
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: Great air hammer
customer_reviews.text: Great air hammer, Use to fix my house with no problems at all. Oil before use each time and after.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Guru

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck if roofing isn't your job.
customer_reviews.text: Thank god I had this. For the price you can't beat it. I'm no roofer so i won't use this on a regular basis. But for the few roofs I may do and having it for my roof I can't complain. It may be a little cheaply made but it worked and worked good. Oil it.... very little misfires. Only the last nail on a role would stick. Other than that it was nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Jl

customer_reviews.title: Good nailer for light duty
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a good nailer for my small project. It worked without fail and never jammed. Sometimes the nails did not go in to the same depth, but most likely user inexperience. I am not sure if I would use this in the roofing trade as I think the product would not last long under daily use. This is a good nailer for he price for the infrequent user.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt_Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my use. Cheaper than renting one for the day. I used it on about 700sq ft, and used it to nail drip edge also. There were a few doubles and misses but no more than a nailer that costs 3x as much. I would certainly purchase this again if I needed to add one or purchase one for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: honeydidn't

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I used this nailer to put down about 500 sqft of shingles on a porch that I built on my house and it worked good, no issues. I think this is a great nailer for a DIY type of person like myself, obviously a professional roofer would probably spend a little more money on a better gun.
customer_reviews.author: James Myers

customer_reviews.title: What a steal!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price on a nailing gone. We purchased two to complete our roofing project. Worked just as good as a name brand nailer at a quarter of the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to build 300 ft of fence and it worked great. Very happy with this product especially with the low price point. I was hesitant to purchase since I was concerned with quality at such a low price. Very happy I made the purchase decision it was cheaper than renting one for the week now what other projects will I start?
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, will make roofing much faster
customer_reviews.text: Great nailer, ran through a coil of 1.25" roofing nails on a test right out of the box. Instructions not written well. Came with automatic nail function default and trigger precise option also. A powerful tool
customer_reviews.author: Redque

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Constantly jams or double feed, inconsistent. JUNK dont waste your money. Lesson learned, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: M. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome nailer for the money. Reroofed my house and this thing never missed a beat. Easy to reload. Last nail in the coil falls out letting you know when it’s empty. Had no trouble running it through a lightweight 1/4” air hose. Low air consumption is nice too so it’s easy on the compressor.
customer_reviews.author: RussellJ

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money! Find another one!
customer_reviews.text: This item is crap! It gets jammed about every 10th nail. And will shoot multiples about every 5! Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: Only used to roof an 8x8 shed so far. Worked reasonably well, the plunger on the tip started to jam up a bit, but I think that was due to residue from the shingles. Keep it well lubed and it worked fine
customer_reviews.author: wildscottishblum

customer_reviews.title: Great performance from an inexpensive nail gun
customer_reviews.text: I experienced when the gun ran out of nails, it would continue to cycle. I also determined that the very last nail would fall out immediately after cycling the previous nail. Otherwise I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Price Price Price
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat the price. Drives good never jammed as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: CApt B

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the deal!
customer_reviews.text: My brother used this on day one as a professional roofer for 20something years and was surprised about the speed and accuracy. Quality for so cheap w/ a protection plan!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Price has gone up as soon as it hit the market
customer_reviews.text: it's the best of the best off-brand or not, the price is climbing as it should its a well-made functioning tool, it's our favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Recommended cedar foundation size
customer_reviews.text: Cedar fence soft.. this allowed the correct ring shanked hot dipped nail size to be installed easily 6 nails per board 45 boards no issues. Made contractor use what I wanted reg galvanized seemed to still tear stain.. very happy helped contain budget
customer_reviews.author: cautiouscutie

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall Value
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this for a very long time, but as a contractor I'm pretty happy with the value. Make sure to buy a high-quality nail, as this can jam semi-frequently if you use cheap coil nails. However, I love the loading mechanism and overall functionality. One downside is that it is relatively heavy, but that comes with most Roofing Nailers regardless of brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Did miss having the senior automatic setting, but knew that when I purchased. Used it for installing vinyl siding, no jams no miss fires. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Riley

customer_reviews.title: Work.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, be carefull with this one after 3 nails works like a machine gun put 6 nail on one hole. Beside that will do the work if you go slow with it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Buy different companies
customer_reviews.text: In my experience with this nailer about every 3rd nail it jammed and had to be completely reset that made a big job into a major job ended up returning once I saw it just wasn't going to work.
customer_reviews.author: mike adams

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money, buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality and performance for the money. Accidentally ordered 2. Company was great about turning one arround for full credit.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Kubin

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Best 99.00 dollars I've ever spent on an air tool, surprised how well its been working. Its been used on over 10 squares of roofing and 500 lineal feet of Hardiboard siding with several different brand nails, just keep it oiled daily and make sure to strike the surface level and square and it'll drive the nail flat and true, dont try to use it like a framing gun it wont drive the nail in.
customer_reviews.author: david koshiyama

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: TOTALLY worth it. (I’m close to both a Lowe’s and Home Depot, so if it didn’t, I could have easily gotten a replacement. But that was NOT necessary.) I only needed it for one job. NEVER jammed on me even once. Still works.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just what I need to install my vinyl siding, once you get it setup you are good to go. No problems with 26 squares of siding.
customer_reviews.author: C P F

customer_reviews.title: Not for daily use
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first. But then began to get jammed and didn’t seem to have the power to drive the nails fully into the wood. Almost every other nail would misfire.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Braun

customer_reviews.title: Worth it & reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Like it, worth the price also. Been breaking it n since I got it. Couple times jammed & fires twice but still reliable item.
customer_reviews.author: jackson

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Has a major flaw, depth ajustment doesn't stay in place. Otherwise great quality. returned
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Gary

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Reroofed my house was a very useful addition especially running 6 nails per shingle. Doing garage next. Never jammed up, no air leaks, did double nail once or twice but that was user error.
customer_reviews.author: NATE

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Did 1/4 of house by hand..bought this & did twice as much in same time. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Danny Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great awesome no need to buy another
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical when I ordered it but it has not jammed once and works great..
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for roofing and Hardie Siding
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my garage extension project. Shot over 1500 nails through it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: L. J. Bade

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: My son did a roof on an apartment and said worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: James Buschman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with it. Works perfectly and I did an entire roof with not a single glitch.
customer_reviews.author: George H.

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and works well
customer_reviews.text: Works fine out of the box with no problems. Finished one roof so far.
customer_reviews.author: Capt.Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight mostly plastic
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight mostly plastic but you get what you pay for haven’t used it yet we’ll see what happens
customer_reviews.author: Alan Shumaker

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer for the money
customer_reviews.text: This roofing nailer worked great. Only used it to do my shed.
customer_reviews.author: G. Savidge

customer_reviews.title: Good gun for the price. I would but again if needed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for a roofing job. Both of them have worked great with no miss fires or jams. One was even dropped from the roof about 20 feet on to gravel. Other then a few scratches and some curse words from the guy who dropped it, the gun continued to work without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Harold P.

customer_reviews.title: Roofed a whole garage and house no sweat!
customer_reviews.text: For the cheapest roofing nailer on Amazon, it does the job and does it well! Make sure to keep it lubricated daily with the included oil. Drives nails to full depth and have had no jams of the gun or spooling issues.
customer_reviews.author: Luke A

customer_reviews.title: Very Good nail gun.
customer_reviews.text: This nail gun worked flawlessly on 12.00 sq roof, I'm thankful that it was so reasonably priced
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price for home use
customer_reviews.text: CONS Safety sometimes caught and double tapped. Sometimes didn't nail completely and needed to hammer. PROS Great value for it's price for home use. Easy to follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover

customer_reviews.title: Works well and doesn't jam
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. I prefer the slower trigger option, but it was easy to switch from the more automatic trigger that was on the unit when it arrived. I experienced no jams or miss fires with the unit. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: Good roofing gun for an occasional user.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight. Never one jam. Made the project go fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Baldowsky

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just built a 3 season porch, new roof. Worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Marty goalie

customer_reviews.title: Great for roofing.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. Sometimes would double nail - even with the single nail trigger. Not a huge problem, but I needed to pay attention.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D. Reinert

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This nail gun is great for the price it needs to wear in at first it took about a bundle of shingles to start nailing down perfect but works and does the job 52 bundles of shingles and counting
customer_reviews.author: Joey W.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Works. Skips a little. Bought it to do 4 roofs. Survived all 4 and ready for another
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it
customer_reviews.text: It nailed it. Dont know why i need a more expensive type
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, very well-made and performs exceptionally.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Was going to re rent a nailer for a day they wanted $65. For the a few dollars more I could buy this one. Great choice! Did the job fine, well worth the money. Very pleased !!!
customer_reviews.author: george esposito

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I had so much trouble with this product ,.... It jammed all the time and shot blanks too. It Shot up to ten times without dispensing a nail and also would shoot nails upside down
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Ran 24 bundles in a day with no issues. Ridged plastic housing kinda sux but you get what ya pay for in tools. Strong thick plastic though.
customer_reviews.author: brian goff

customer_reviews.title: A lot of "Double-Firing"
customer_reviews.text: Overall it worked fine for the job I needed to do. It is easy to load and operate, and never jammed once. The only complaint I have is that it double-fires, on average, once for every 4 or 5 single fires.
customer_reviews.author: Brucek

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Picked up from the post office came home put oil in it, nails, hooked it up and out of 10 fires I might get 3 nails. Terrible. Was looking forward to getting it but is worthless
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Browning.

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap gun.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advised. Bought it for roofing my garage had no trouble with it the entire time never jammed or failed to shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no good by a boss stage
customer_reviews.text: did not work as promised you would have to hammer more nails in by hand then you would buy the gun
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working good.
customer_reviews.text: its a good tool to have works great and the $ is good.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Sherpa

customer_reviews.title: great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: used to roof both my sheds never skipped a beat cheaper than renting glad i bought it
customer_reviews.author: don p.

customer_reviews.title: All Good
customer_reviews.text: Finished roof of my house start to finish flawlessly Im happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good fun for the price likes to double every once in a while but all in all a good value
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for a budget coil nailer. Works as prescribed.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: roofing nailer
customer_reviews.text: works as good as the high dollar roofing nailers great price and product
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good nail gun for the price. Didn't have any problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Deez Nuts

customer_reviews.title: not sure how long it will last , have not used it yet
customer_reviews.text: looks good will know better after 50 sq of use.
customer_reviews.author: len c.

customer_reviews.title: ... to complete my entire roof and I am well satisfied with the service Thank you so much
customer_reviews.text: I used my roofing nail guns to complete my entire roof and I am well satisfied with the service Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Mazyck

customer_reviews.title: even worse, when you connect the nail gun to air ...
customer_reviews.text: The product I received has a number of major issues. The safety feature that is supposed to prevent nailing without contact does not work, even worse, when you connect the nail gun to air it fires. It also has a habit of trying to send out multiple nails at once, which of course doesn't work. To be fair its possible that the one I got was just defective, however, if so the defects are major enough to be wary of getting this product.
customer_reviews.author: ben pettibone

customer_reviews.title: Good for non-precision work.
customer_reviews.text: This nailer worked well for me to quickly put up fence staves. However I notice that the depth the driven nail varies quite a bit. I'm not sure this would be acceptable if I were using this for nailing roof shingles which need to have the nail head almost exactly flush with the surface of the shingle.
customer_reviews.author: robcat2075

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far it's working fine but mostly plastic. One drop and it's toast
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your
customer_reviews.text: Broke first time I used it. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Its not good for doing roofing on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Macedonio

product_meta.title: 3PLUS HCN45SP 11 Gauge 15 Degree 3/4" to 1-3/4" Coil Roofing Nailer
feature_bullets: Drives 3/4-Inch to 1-3/4-Inch full head coil roofing nails;
Adjustable shingle guide for quick shingle spacing;
Integrated side skid pads prevent the tool from sliding off roof when placed on its side;
High-capacity magazine holds up to 120 coil nails at a time; Tool free adjustable depth of drive for consistent and controllable nail fit; 360° tool-free air exhaust.
Interchangeable trigger for single shot or bumper fire function.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars228 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
